Mr. Kenneth Harwood, Chairman
January 16, 1938
Page 3
I am also bothered by her last paragraph on the last page. It sounds
as though the NASH research money will be used for "publicity" for
the series and a number of other things. X am not sure that this Is
justifiable. X also do not see why we should pay this girl a salary
to work on her master's thesis nor the travel expenses for performers
on the television programs. Perhaps we could pay for the Purdue tests
and materials for testing — not for 'Hiscussioa.* 6100.00 maximum.
Collage of St, Thomas comas In a poor last. The hypothesis, as
stated. Is not testable. As a matter of fact. It Is meaningless with¬
out a specific criterion — or operational definition of "successfully,"
which is not given. WO never do find out what they plan to measure ~
what kind of data they plan to obtain. If they can coma up with a
testable hypothesis and operations by which it can be tested, the
question Itself is Interesting. X could see giving them $230.00 if
they did the above and agreed to gather at least a good portion of
their data by depth or focused Interviews. Do not think you can get
much on a subject of this sort by questionnaire*.
All of ay comments, as 1 look back at what X have said, sound
pretty presumptuous. 1 do not know how far we can go In suggesting
improvements In research designs, nils is rather delicate, (hi the
other hand, if properly put, X do not know why suggestions cannot be
made — especially if the suggestions come with greenbacks to soften
the blow.
X hope that the above Is helpful. As soon as X received these
proposals, X realised that X gave you a devil of a job. X ms sure
that you will act wisely. Let me say also that after all the returns
are in, it seems to me that you should feel free to use your discretion
in the interpretation of the results and the action which you take.
As in most such matters, at one point, some one person must simply
make some decisions. X think you can do it wisely — using our sug¬
gestions as suggestions, rather then as a strait-jacket.
By the way, X asked Harry Skornia to have Percy Tannenbaum look
these over also and give his reactions, which you should receive.
Their offices are just across the hall and X felt this would give one
additional judge — to make your life more complex.
Sincerely,
Sam L. Becker
